page.title: 07History of Grafham Church.
page.content: The north arcade of the nave of{All {Saints Church} dates from around 1250, and is the oldest part of the present church. The Chancel was built about 1300 and the South Chapel in the early 14th Century. The North aisle was rebuilt at the end of the same century. The tower and spire date from 1400 but the stair turret is 15th Century. The rood stairs at the east end of the North aisle are 15th Century and the porch was built in 1657. The spire is 83 feet and 3 inches high and stair turret is octagonal. The font dates from the 14th Century. The first recorded incumbent in 1222 was Richard Russel. In 1966 Grafham combined with the parishes of Ellington, Spaldwick, Barham with Woolley and Easton with a priest in charge.
